body:
<!-- Please use this template while reporting a bug and provide as much info as possible. Not doing so may result in your bug not being addressed in a timely manner. Thanks!

If the matter is security related, please disclose it privately via https://kubernetes.io/security/
-->


**What happened**:

Running annotations on multiple nodes at the same time unexpectedly succeeds.

```
kubectl annotate cm/sequence id=5 --resource-version=123456 --overwrite
```

Each node receives a success with its own updates in the response and the same _new_ resourceVersion.

**What you expected to happen**:

I expect that only one of these annotations would succeed with every other one getting a conflict error.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:

Open 2 tmux panes and broadcast the command.

**Anything else we need to know?**:

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): 

```
Client Version: "v1.16.0"
Server Version:"v1.10.11"
```

- Cloud provider or hardware configuration: Happens on both AWS and GCP
- OS (e.g: `cat /etc/os-release`):
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):
- Install tools:
- Network plugin and version (if this is a network-related bug):
- Others:

It looks like the resourceVersion check is happening on the client side based on the requests/responses logged in the command. Is that the case?

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG CLI.
labels.name: sig/cli

title: Using resourceVersion on different annotate requests does not guarantee atomic updates
